page.title: 09Abstraction Scheme-Airport
page.content: present, will be reduced and water supplies found from Alwen on the Denbigh Moors. The works employs 8 plant operators but some of these will soon be moved elsewhere. HAWARDEN AIRPORT Three miles south west of Chester, the field is 100 acres. The Airfield expanded in 1939. Their first contract was in May 1939 for 750 Wellington bombers. There was a dummy factory in Saltney, so the real factory wouldn't get bombed. They built Wellington X5 and Lancasters there. The only air raid was in 1940, 28 aircraft were damaged.Two hangers damaged. 1940, 6th October, Alex Henshaw, Chief Test Pilot gave an impressive demonstration of the Spitfire. In the Northwest they had virtually no fighter defences
